alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Inland Central Coast; San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; San Luis Obispo County Mountains; Santa Lucia Mountains; Southern Salinas Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 13 at 1:26PM PDT until March 14 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County. * WHEN...From late tonight through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rain and excessive runoff may result in dangerous flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Rivers and creeks that may be affected include, but are not limited to, the Salinas River, Arroyo Grande Creek and Santa Rosa Creek. Extensive street flooding is likely. There may be mudslides and rockslides, especially in and near steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
